alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:24PM CDT until June 25 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN CARROLL...NORTHWESTERN STEPHENSON... JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 924 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from New Diggings to near Bellevue to near Lost Nation, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Maquoketa, Galena, DeWitt, Savanna, Bellevue, Stockton, Warren, Preston, Hanover, Elizabeth, Woodbine, Sabula, Delmar, Lost Nation, Miles, Andrew, Charlotte, Scales Mound, Apple River and Welton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
